page.topic: Getting a Google Maps API key
page.description: Features such as maps and geocoding are built on services provided by Google. A Google API key is required to use these features in your Alpha Anywhere applications.

discussion.p: The Map control and geocoding functions require API key to use it in a application. If no API key is supplied, you may see an [error message] in place of a map, in a popup message, or in the console log. If this happens, you need to create and add an APK key to your application for the Google API that is required to use the feature.

section.title: How to get an API key from Google

description.p: An API key can be created using the *[extlink:Google Cloud console@https://console.cloud.google.com/]*. If you do not have a Google account, you will need to create one to get an API key.

Once logged into the Google Cloud console, you will first need to create a Project if you do not already have a Project. Once you've created the project, you can navigate to the *[extlink:APIs & Services dashboard@https://console.cloud.google.com/apis/dashboard]* to create an API key:
In the *[ui:Library]* section, locate the Google Maps API you'd like to enable. The following APIs are used with Alpha Anywhere:

item.name: Maps JavaScript API
item.description: Required for most Google Maps operations, such as displaying a map, plotting markers on a map, or using Google Address auto-complete.

item.name: Geocoding API
item.description: Required for translating an Address (123 N Main St, Springfield, MA) into latitude and longitude coordinates or calling the [geocode_address()] Xbasic function.

item.name: Maps Static API
item.description: Required for generating and embedding a static map in an app.

description.p: Click the *[ui:Enable]* button to add the API to your project.
Next, navigate to *[ui:Credentials]*. Then, click *[ui:Create Credentials]* and select *[ui:API key]* from the dropdown.
Copy the API key. This API key can be entered in Alpha Anywhere in the Project Properties or Map control properties to enable access to the Google Maps API.

It's recommended to restrict what applications (or sites) can use your API key and what APIs someone can access using the API key. You can do this by editing the API key in the *[ui:Credentials]* section. Access restrictions can be modified at any time.

To restrict the API key to specific sites or applications (e.g. Android or iOS applications), locate the Application restrictions section and select the type of application that will use your API key. Enter the required URL(s), IP Address(es), Android app, or iOS app information for the chosen application.

tip.p: You can create multiple API keys if you have multiple applications that will require access.

description.p: To restrict the API key to specific Google APIs, locate the *[ui:API restrictions]* section and select *[ui:Restrict key]*. Select the APIs from the dropdown box that you'd like to include.
When you are finished updating restrictions, click *[ui:Save]* to save your changes.

step.description: Once have an API key, you can enter it in Project Properties.

description.p: Add the key to the corresponding Google API key property.

Alternatively, your API key can be added to your project as a file stored in the Alpha Anywhere installation folder. Storing the key in your installation folder reduces the risk of accidentally exposing your API credentials in projects stored in public GitHub repositories (or other public source control solutions.)

item.name: GoogleMapsAPIKey.txt
item.description: Maps JavaScript API key. Will be used if the *[ui:Google Maps API key]* property is blank.

item.name: GoogleStaticMapsAPIKey.txt
item.description: Maps Static API key. Will be used if the *[ui:Google Static Maps API Key]* property is blank.

item.name: GoogleGeoCodingAPIKey.txt
item.description: Geocoding API key. Will be used if the *[ui:Google Geocoding API Key]* property is blank.

note.p: If Alpha Anywhere is installed in the "Program Files (x86)" folder, you will need Administrator privileges in order to create the API file(s).
